titleStmt.title: Historical collections, or, An exact account of the proceedings of the four last parliaments of Q. Elizabeth of famous memory wherein is contained the compleat journals both of Lords & Commons, taken from the original records of their houses : as also the more particular behaviours of the worthy members during all the last notable sessions, comprehending the motions, speeches, and arguments of the renowned and learned secretary Cecill, Sir Francis Bacon, Sir Walter Rawleigh, Sir Edw. Hobby, and divers other eminent gentlemen : together with the most considerable passages of the history of those times / faithfully and laboriously collected, by Heywood Townshend ...
titleStmt.author: Townshend, Hayward, b. 1577.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for T. Basset, W. Crooke, and W. Cademan ...,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
